Assessment.QuestionText: You want to connect to a table named <font face="courier new">Products</font> in an OLE DB supported database to retrieve the number of fields. Which one of the following codes will help you to achieve this?

Options.Option:
OleDbCommand oledbcomProducts = new OleDbCommand("SELECT * FROM
Products");
OleDbDataReader oledbdreaderProducts =
oledbcomProducts.ExecuteReader();
int numberOfFields = oledbdreaderProducts.FieldCount;
MessageBox.Show("Number of Fields: " + numberOfFields);

OleDbCommand oledbcomProducts = new OleDbCommand("SELECT * FROM
Products");
OleDbDataReader oledbdreaderProducts =
oledbcomProducts.ExecuteReader();
int numberOfFields = oledbdreaderProducts.FieldCount();
MessageBox.Show("Number of Fields: " + numberOfFields);

OleDbCommand oledbcomProducts = new OleDbCommand("SELECT * FROM
Products", oledbconProducts);
OleDbDataReader oledbdreaderProducts =
oledbcomProducts.ExecuteReader();
int numberOfFields = oledbdreaderProducts.FieldCount;
MessageBox.Show("Number of Fields: " + numberOfFields);

OleDbCommand oledbcomProducts = new OleDbCommand("SELECT * FROM
Products", oledbconProducts);
OleDbDataReader oledbdreaderProducts =
oledbcomProducts.ExecuteReader();
int numberOfFields = oledbdreaderProducts.FieldCount();
MessageBox.Show("Number of Fields: " + numberOfFields);

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selection is: (C).
